keywords.value: Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: A vote by the school’s board is meant to address an inquiry by the New York state attorney general’s office over finances and a decision to charge tuition.

headline.print_headline: Cooper Union, in Deal Over Inquiry Into Tuition, Offers to Let President Go
headline.main: Cooper Union Offers to Let President Go as Part of Deal With State Attorney General

snippet: A vote by the school’s board is meant to address an inquiry by the New York state attorney general’s office over finances and a decision to charge tuition.
abstract: Board of privately funded Cooper Union college offers to dismiss president Jamshed Bharucha in effort to hasten conclusion of inquiry into institution's finances by office of New York State Atty Gen Eric T Schneiderman; investigation was prompted by lawsuit filed after Cooper Union announced it would charge tuition for first time in its history.
